comment: Kabbara is condescending and does not take classes seriously. He was late majority of the time and gave smart remarks to questions asked. I would not recommend him at all, he should not be teaching he obviously does it for the money and not because he enjoys helping students learn.

1. Reads off PowerPoints.
2. Goes over problems in class that will be similar to the test. He also gives out homework that is similar to the test. HW is not graded for completion. 
3. Quizzes are online and open note. 
4. Test Heavy class
5. Textbook is helpful in showing you how to solve problems. Test are quantitative and qualitative

This was one of the most frustrating classes I've taken. The professor was consistently late to class and relied entirely on reading directly from the PowerPoint slides with little added explanation. When going over test problems, they frequently made mistakes, which only added to the confusion. Communication was poor emails often went unanswered.

Strength of Materials Lab: Each lab session would have some error or issue that would cause the data recorded to be wrong. Minimum directions were given, while it seemed as though they did not fully understand what they were doing. All lab participation feedback was vague and limited. Where you would get grades back after three weeks or more.

This Online course was terrible. Lectures were useless, did not have access to the right answers after quizzes, got very little feedback on tests, and absolutely no leniency for late homework submissions. Test study guides also did not show how problems were solved, only had answers. Taught myself everything using Chegg and the internet.
Professor Kabbara is a good teacher and a nice person. He explains things well and his lectures are clear. He was available online to answer my questions. Be prepared to study though!

Good professor. I liked his class. He challenged us with a lot of quizzes, extra credit, and homework etc.. His lectures are coherent and helpful with lots of solved examples. Beware though, you must study a lot to get an A/B in his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Never take him again. He is just reading power point. well this is not history class, solve some problems not just examples which is already give.

I took his class thinking I was going to get a more relaxed schedule as most online courses give you, WRONG! The solutions he would post to the quizzes or tests did not help you figure out what you did wrong, it just has the answer. He took forever to respond to emails and the class structure was hard to follow. I will be choosing a different proff

All he does is read off powerpoints and solve examples already in said ppts. He doesn't go over homework or tests. The "feedback" he gives is literally always "Refer to HW (or exam) solutions" that he uploaded recently. While accessible outside class, he is not helpful at all in explaining concepts. Nice man, terrible teacher.

HE IS ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. He just reads over the power point and dont explain anything. The average for the tests where 50s and non of us learned anything. I took him for strength of Materials and this class is the backbone of civil engineering engineering courses and I learned absolutely NOTHING. Had to withdraw since he dont know how to teach
